text:
"Edge" and "Edge
for Business" are the same install, but Edge for Business is automatically
activated when users are signed in using a Microsoft Entra ID (f.k.a. Azure
Active Directory). See the FAQ below for management info. Microsoft Edge for
Business FAQ
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcommunity.microsoft.com%2Ft5%2Fmicrosoft-edge-insider%2Fmicrosoft-edge-for-business-faq%2Fba-p%2F3891837&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C6391bfdf86654e48285308dc272c1e7b%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638428317644960531%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Mpe3XSo%2F0ZJmST8Zda%2F6FGj0Kel%2FTMAGsjW0cu0xZU4%3D&reserved=0
Jody MacKercher Positron Computer Services

metadata.topic: Re: Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or just plain Edge?
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Re: Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or just plain Edge?
metadata.email_text_original:
[You don't often get email from jmac@pcs-consulting.net. Learn why this is
important at https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ] "Edge" and "Edge
for Business" are the same install, but Edge for Business is automatically
activated when users are signed in using a Microsoft Entra ID (f.k.a. Azure
Active Directory). See the FAQ below for management info. Microsoft Edge for
Business FAQ
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcommunity.microsoft.com%2Ft5%2Fmicrosoft-edge-insider%2Fmicrosoft-edge-for-business-faq%2Fba-p%2F3891837&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C6391bfdf86654e48285308dc272c1e7b%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638428317644960531%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Mpe3XSo%2F0ZJmST8Zda%2F6FGj0Kel%2FTMAGsjW0cu0xZU4%3D&reserved=0
Jody MacKercher Positron Computer Services -----Original Message----- From:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com On Behalf Of Hammer, Erich F Sent: Tuesday,
February 6, 2024 10:19 AM To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com Subject: RE:
[patchmanagement] Re: Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or
just plain Edge? OK, now I'm confused and must have missed something. What is
"Edge for Business"? I thought all Win10 installs since [some version] came with
Chromium-based Edge. Prior to [some version], I was deploying "Edgium" to
replace the original Edge, but I've stopped in the belief that the built-in Edge
was the same as the download. Are their two versions -- Enterprise and Consumer
-- of Chromium Edge? Do I need to be installing "Edge for Business" in Win10 in
order to properly/fully manage Edge settings? Thanks, Erich On Monday, February
5, 2024 at 20:25, Sysadminbeard eloquently inscribed: >
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fedge%2Fbusiness%2Fdownload%3Fform%3DMA13FJ&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C6391bfdf86654e48285308dc272c1e7b%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638428317644968778%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=IoqjlCbocp9rPbfX7py81%2B1dMJgsnfLPxhL7WLt3PVg%3D&reserved=0
Link: None
